result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JAMES J GREEN

defendant.name: GREEN, JAMES J
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant JAMES J GREEN in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant if he wants the preliminary hearing. Defendant requests the preliminary hearing. Court goes over right to counsel and the time limits. Defendant requests to have the prelim now.

Jessica Liptow sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is a sex offender registry specialist with the Department of Corrections. Identified the defendant present in court. Testimony given. Cross exam by defendant. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State is filing an information. Court will set for Arraignment on November 15, 2022 at 3:00 PM. 

Court adjourned at 2:24 PM
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant needs to comply with the sex offender registry.

Warrant Canceled - Spoke to Sam from Dispatch
Defendant needs to comply with the sex offender registry.

1:12 PM Defendant JAMES J GREEN in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson in court for the defendant. Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $1,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant needs to comply with the sex offender registry. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Prelim October 31, 2022 at 2:15 PM. Court quashes warrant.

Court adjourned at 1:20 PM
Warrant sent down to GLSO on 05/20/2022.
